summary: Email chain regarding subpoenas issued to Interlochen Center for the Arts for records related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. The emails discuss the production of documents including student rosters from 1994-1998, with password-protected files being delivered to the FBI.

persons.name: George B. Donnini
persons.role: Attorney representing Interlochen Center for the Arts
persons.context: Attorney who sent the email confirming production of documents responsive to subpoenas issued to Interlochen Center for the Arts in the Epstein/Maxwell case.

events.title: Subpoena issued to Interlochen Center for the Arts
events.description: First subpoena issued to Interlochen Center for the Arts for records related to Epstein/Maxwell case.

events.title: Second subpoena issued to Interlochen Center for the Arts
events.description: Second subpoena issued to Interlochen Center for the Arts for records related to Epstein/Maxwell case.

events.title: Documents delivered to FBI
events.description: FedEx package containing responsive documents from Interlochen Center for the Arts delivered to FBI.

keyFacts: Subpoenas were issued to Interlochen Center for the Arts on February 6 and February 10, 2020, for records related to Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell.
The produced documents included student rosters from 1994-1998, with specific mention that 'all attended the Arts Camp in 1994'.
The documents were delivered to the FBI via FedEx and were password-protected, with the password provided in the correspondence.
Attorney George B. Donnini represented Interlochen Center for the Arts in responding to the subpoenas.
The email chain shows coordination between legal counsel and law enforcement regarding the document production process.
